image.altText: An Indigenous woman standing outside a construction site.

props.synopsis: Decades after Wadeye's last licensed social club was smashed to pieces amid a storm of controversy, locals will again soon be able to have an after work drink.

title.children: Wadeye to bring back liquor sales after 30 years as dry community

image.altText: Royal Darwin Hospital Intensive Care Unit

props.synopsis: The Acacia system was switched off at Royal Darwin Hospital's emergency department in January 2024 after it became a threat to patient safety.

title.children: Controversial patient record system to return to NT emergency department

image.altText: An aerial view of Cape Van Diemen on Melville Island, part of the Tiwi Islands

props.synopsis: Bodies representing remote Indigenous Australians have warned that communities are becoming uninhabitable, as they push the federal government to strengthen proposed environmental reforms.

title.children: Land councils say federal government did not consult them on environment reform

image.altText: An onshore gas facility, as viewed from across the harbour.

props.synopsis: An oil spill that leaked into Darwin Harbour and the substantial under-reporting of toxic emissions have put one of Australia's biggest gas companies under federal investigation.

title.children: Oil spill, emissions error trigger gas giant federal investigation

image.altText: Tall buildings seen from a few kilometres away over leafy suburbs and water

props.synopsis: People across the Northern Territory's Top End woke to shaking in the early hours during a magnitude-6.4 earthquake in the Banda Sea near Timor-Leste.

title.children: Top End wakes to shaking from magnitude-6.4 earthquake in Banda Sea

image.altText: CDP participant at Crowhurst

props.synopsis: Three Aboriginal Northern Territory councils say they will cancel leases critical to the rollout of the federal government's new jobs program after they claim they were overlooked for funding because they were "not Aboriginal enough".

title.children: 'The final straw': Remote councils threaten to disrupt $2.6b remote jobs program

image.altText: 80-year-old Aboriginal women sits in the desert playing guitar, flanked by a young boy

props.synopsis: Icons, innovators, and unexpected gems — WOMADelaide's 2026 line-up promises a truly unique festival experience.

title.children: From Yothu Yindi to Iron & Wine — WOMADelaide's line-up is here

image.altText: A montage of images including the back of a person and two newspaper clippings, one with a headline about "fondle claims".

props.synopsis: Victims of a paedophile who used children's artwork to hide abuse are suing the Victorian Education Department, alleging his abuse should have been stopped earlier.

title.children: Victims say paedophile teacher groomed them to believe students were his 'wives'

image.altText: A tanned Aboriginal woman walking with a white man with a beard, she's wearing blue blazer, white top, brown hair.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has been accused of "using her position" to "promote" her defamation of Central Land Council CEO Lesley Turner, on the final day of the Federal Court civil defamation trial.

title.children: Senator accused of 'using her position' to defame land council boss

image.altText: Men in dark suits, including Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump, sit at a dinner table with drinks.

props.synopsis: A select group of world leaders have dined with United States President Donald Trump in South Korea, including Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

title.children: Albanese joins Trump and other leaders for 'special dinner' in South Korea

image.altText: Kamala Harris looks at Joe Biden as he speaks from a presidential lectern.

props.synopsis: Richard Nixon did what Kamala Harris wants to. But for her to get to the White House, she is going to have to make tough decisions she has failed to in the past.

title.children: Joe Biden was exposed by his frailties. They're still exposing Kamala Harris

image.altText: People walk through rubble around a damaged building

props.synopsis: The Israeli military said it would abide by a ceasefire accord in Gaza, as health officials in the enclave said IDF air strikes had killed 104 people.

title.children: Israeli air strikes kill 104 in Gaza, Trump insists ceasefire will hold

image.altText: Childcare regulator

props.synopsis: Despite increasing rates of reporting over the last five years, few investigations have resulted in strong action by the NSW regulator.

title.children: Hundreds of accused childcare workers not punished by regulator

image.altText: A composite image of signage of Australia's 'big four' banks ANZ, Westpac, the Commonwealth Bank and NAB signage

props.synopsis: A shock from the all-important consumer price index has left economists rewriting their rates outlooks, ahead of the Reserve Bank meeting next week.

title.children: Major bank economists rule out November rate cut, review forecasts

image.altText: crypto atm scam victim Dorothy Dyall, Oct 2025

props.synopsis: A pensioner tells her nightmarish story as the financial crimes regulator takes action against a second Australian player in the booming crypto ATM business linked to lucrative scams and money laundering.

title.children: A shocking alarm on her computer sent Dorothy into crypto scam hell

image.altText: Lynda Henderson aged care

props.synopsis: With major changes to the aged care system looming this week, price hikes for older people accessing support at home could mean their aged care packages will not stretch as far.

title.children: Seniors risk losing some at-home services in Support at Home roll out

image.altText: A woman looks seriously down the barrel of a camera.

props.synopsis: A woman, who was unable to call triple-0 after men broke into her home while she was in her bedroom, is demanding answers from the telco as calls ramp up for a complete overhaul of the system.

title.children: Woman demands answers after triple-0 calls failed during robbery

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: The US central bank cut interest rates overnight but it wasn't a unanimous decision. James Hardie investors have ousted the company's chair and several directors in a backlash against a controversial takeover deal. Follow live.

title.children: ASX set to dip as Federal Reserve divided on rates

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Microsoft's massive AI spending draws investor concern
Major bank economists rule out November RBA interest rate cut

image.altText: Murray Watt frowns.

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt says the government's overhauled environmental laws will need to be passed "now or never". Follow live.

title.children: 'Now or never' moment on environmental protection laws, minister says

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australians should be 'scared' if Labor does deal with Greens on environment laws
Ministerial powers in bill should only be used in 'very rare circumstances': Watt
'Now or never' moment on environmental protection laws: Murray Watt

image.altText: Concept art of woman working at a computer opposite a robot working at a computer.

props.synopsis: There's an increasing number of tools that block AIs from training themselves on online information. How do they work, and will they change the way AIs and the internet operate?

title.children: New arms race flares as AI takes your content and blockers fight back

image.altText: A coal fire power station sitting just behind a large dam

props.synopsis: Emergency services and volunteers are back on scene scouring water and the dam's edges for signs of the boy.

title.children: Search restarts for teenager missing after swimming at dam

image.altText: A blind possum with overgrown teeth is swaddled in a grey balnket.

props.synopsis: Research is underway to try and identify a mystery illness affecting critically endangered western ringtail possum populations in the South West.

title.children: Mystery illness leaving possums blind and paralysed in WA

image.altText: Musician Lily Allen struggles with bags of groceries at the front door of a residence

props.synopsis: Lily Allen has dropped her first album in seven years and it is... revealing. We asked Australian artists about turning pain into power, and why break-up songs resonate so deeply with fans.

title.children: Aussie artists on what it's like to share a break-up with the world

image.altText: Five people stand in front of a prison.

props.synopsis: The Malmsbury community had big dreams for the future of a decommissioned youth justice centre in town. Then came the news it was reopening.

title.children: Community blindsided by reopening of youth justice centre

image.altText: A cruise ship on the water with an island in the background.

props.synopsis: The death of an 80-year-old woman who was left on a remote tropical island after a cruise stop has reignited debate over passenger safety standards on the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Cruise tragedy sparks calls for tighter safety rules on Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: a teenage girl stands in front of dresses

props.synopsis: The Australian government's ban on social media for children aged under 16 will come into effect in December.

title.children: Teenage business owner says social media critical for success

image.altText: A selfie of a young man with a short beard smiling

props.synopsis: Almost two dozen sexual abuse complaints have been made against Tasmanian childcare workers since 2020, most of them by parents.

title.children: 'Matt and I have a secret': The abuse complaints made against Tasmanian childcare workers

image.altText: Phar Lap with jockey Jim Pike riding at Flemington race track circa 1930

props.synopsis: As the 2025 Melbourne Cup approaches, two musicals celebrating — and satirising — the life of Phar Lap premiere, with 'Australia's greatest racehorse' brought to life with an actor and a puppeteer.

title.children: Phar Lap turns 100 in 2026. This year, two musicals inspired by him debut

image.altText: Jarin Baigent with grandmother Millie Ingram stand in front of an indigenous mural in redfern

props.synopsis: City of Sydney Council has awarded a car park site in Redfern worth $20 million to Wyanga Aboriginal Aged Care for the nominal fee of $1.

title.children: Council awards car park site to Indigenous aged care provider for $1 fee

image.altText: A new Spirit of Tasmania vessel berthed in Leith in Scotland

props.synopsis: From wharfless ferries to bungled design specifications costing millions, the troubled Spirit of Tasmania ship replacement project saga just keeps rolling on.

title.children: How Tasmania's ferry operator made a multi-million-dollar mistake

image.altText: Peter Cowell in admiral whites and cap.

props.synopsis: Peter Cowell's whereabouts have been unknown since July 2024, but the ABC has tracked him down to suburban Perth.

title.children: 'Fake' Australian admiral discovered a year after vanishing

image.altText: A necklace and earrings on display in a cabinet at the Louvre.

props.synopsis: Four hooded thieves made off with the treasures after breaking into the Louvre on the morning of October 19, exposing security lapses at the world's most-visited museum.

title.children: Louvre suspects to be charged with theft and conspiracy, says Paris prosecutor

image.altText: Laura Wolvaardt raises her bat as she celebrates a century at the World Cup.

props.synopsis: As Australia prepares to play India in the second semifinal, South Africa books its berth in the tournament decider following a commanding performance against England.

title.children: South Africa dominates England to reach World Cup final

image.altText: A bombed out window with concrete and glass all over the room.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says the attack shows that Russia is the "largest terrorist organisation in the world".

title.children: Russia bombs children's hospital, Vance says Ukraine war will end 'eventually'

image.altText: A dozer at the Reedy Creek landfill site on the Gold Coast

props.synopsis: Gold Coast residents could soon be charged 300 per cent more for their waste as landfill runs low. The council is betting on waste-to-energy as part of the solution, but the technology comes with caveats.

title.children: Burn or bury? Gold Coast weighs $1.6-billion plan to deal with rubbish
